decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved drawings and documents: Planning, Design and Access Statement, Existing Drawings 1094.01, Proposed Drawings 1094.02.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

| A minimum of three (3) cycle parking spaces shall be provided within the front curtilage of the development in a secure compound. Such provision shall be brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.
Reason: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy T5 of the London Plan (2021).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 as amended by the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015, the hereby permitted residential care home shall only be used under Class C2 and not for any other use without permission of the Local Planning Authority obtained by the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To protect the character and amenity of the area and to safeguard the employment land in accordance with 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), Policies D3, D14, E8 of the London Plan, policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
| The hereby permitted residential care home capacity shall be maximum 4 children with the age range between 8 - 18 years. The property should be supervised at all times by qualified staff members.
Reason: To protect and safeguard the future residents in accordance with policy S3 of the London Plan (2021).
| The hereby approved residential care home shall be registered and operate under  an Ofsted registration. All placements at the home shall be appropriately matched by age.
Reason: To protect and safeguard the future residents in accordance with policy S3 of the London Plan (2021).
description: Change of use from single dwellinghouse (Use Class C3) to residential care home (Use Class C2) for children with Special Educational Needs and Disabilities ('SEND') or Learning Difficulties ('LD') or Emotional and Behavioural Difficulties ('EBD') and associated alterations
